questions.question: I ……………………….. a movie when the lights went out.
questions.description: When one verb is in the past tense, the other verbs too will most probably be in the past tense.

questions.question: I ……………………….. dinner when the guests arrived.
questions.description: When one verb is in the past tense, the other verbs too will most probably be in the past tense.

questions.question: I …………………………. now.
questions.description: Now is a present time expression.

questions.question: ‘Where are the kids?’ ‘They ……………………….. in the garden.’
questions.description: When the reference is to the present time, use present tenses.

questions.question: The guests …………………………. in the lobby.
questions.description: When there is no time reference assume that we are talking about now.

questions.question: It ………………………….. We cannot go out now.
The mother ………………………….. for the child to return.
I …………………………. for the bus when the accident took place.
questions.description: When one verb is in the past tense, the other verbs too will most probably be in the past tense.

questions.question: I ………………………….. in Mumbai at that time.
questions.description: At that time shows distance. Use past tenses with it.

questions.question: I …………………………. when the phone rang.
questions.description: When one verb is in the past tense, the other verbs too will most probably be in the past tense.
